name: Tarta de queso La Viña
description: /'The Vineyard cheesecake'/ Recipe from the restaurant 'La Viña' in the Basque region of Spain.

For 1L small mold: 8 g flour (can substitute with corn starch)
500 g cream cheese (see variants for substitutions)
Little amount of oil or butter
For 2L / 23 cm mold: (This is the original size. Double the ingredients, use 7 eggs, no extra yolk. Increase oven time by 5-10')

instructions: - Beat eggs and progresively add flour/sugar. Pour in a separate container and shortly beat the cheese with the heavy cream. Mix both.
- Lightly grease the mold and place inside some oven paper, shaping it. Pour mixture and into the oven 40-45'.
- When the top is caramelized around 25-35', place some aluminum foil on top to prevent it from burning.
- It should jiggle slightly by the end. Turn the oven off, leave inside 5', 1h with the door open and 4-6h in the fridge.
variants: Sometimes cream cheese is not available. Keeping in mind it has ~30% fat, a substitution that ends somewhere near that quantity should turn out similarly. I've done it with half ricotta (10% fat) half mascarpone (40%) and it worked out nicely.

culinary: Do not attempt to take it out of the mold before it's cold since it may crumble easily.
serving: It is traditionally served in the same baking paper and mold
